I added
C:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_2.0.0/jdtCompilerAdapter.jar
C:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.core_2.0.0/jdtcore.jar
C:/java/lib/tools.jar
to the External Tools->Ant CLASSPATH

But still the same exception was thrown.

So the jdtCompilerAdapter.jar is NO LONGER in the eclipse classpath and I 
cannot seem to add it to the Ant classpath either.

This is severe bug for the ANT platform.

I am using F1 build.

The JDT compiler adapter is now called 
org.eclipse.jdt.core.JDTCompilerAdapter. You don't need to add its JAR to the 
classpath. It is automatically discovered by Eclipse.
Closing.

Then can somebody please change the Eclipse FAQ because the name of the class 
is still incorrect over there

I changed the build.compiler to org.eclipse.jdt.core.JDTCompilerAdapter and I 
still receive the Build exception

What about the tools.jar, I cannot add it to the ANT classpath.
What build are you using?
Build F1

I can't reproduce your problem with build F1. I'm not sure how you get the 
error. Please provide detailed steps to reproduce (starting from a fresh 
workspace, for example).

You should be able to use either the JDT compiler adapter or javac (just 
adding tools.jar to the Ant classpath should make the classic compiler 
available).

Thanks for pointing out the out-of-date FAQ.

I have an existing workspace from the M5 build.  My workspace is C:\workspace
I deleted C:\eclipse my install directory.
Installed the F1 build to C:\eclipse
Tried to run my build.xml which had build.compiler property set to a class that 
has migrated (the JDTCompilerAdapter)
I get the above exception.

Then I tried to change the classpath and add above mentioned jars.
Still the same exception.

file or stack traces to a bug report, please use the "Create a new attachment" 
option. It is much better to navigate the bug report and separate examples 
from comments.

Created an attachment (id=1294)
Contents of C:/workspace/.metadata/.plugins folder

Rodrigo,

My install dir is C:/eclipse.  My workspace directory is more than 8 months old 
and is C:/workspace.

I delete C:/eclipse whenever I reinstall a new build.  I do not touch 
C:/workspace

After installing F2 build, all my build.xml files stopped working.  Ant 
internal error, see console log.

There were no exceptions in the log or in the .log file

I went and deleted org.eclipse.ant.core and org.eclipse.ant.ui from 
the .plugins directory and restarted eclipse.

The existing build.xml files now work

I have attached the contents of my ant .plugins files in the problems.zip file.

I think all my problems with Ant not picking up the jdtCompilerAdapater and not 
recognizing javac are related to this problem.

I will investigate and inform you.

-Shakeel

It seems that the only thing you need to do is restore the Ant Classpath in 
Window->Preferences->External Tools->Restore Defaults plus adding any extra 
JARs you need (e.g. tools.jar) (it should have the same effect as deleting the 
metadata for org.eclipse.ant.core). Let us know if that works and if it 
doesn't please add the .log file or what you get in the console.

Rodrigo

I tried doing Restore Defaults with no luck.

-Shakeel

That is really strange. The ant.ui metadata can be removed anyway since that 
plug-in is not part of the Eclipse SDK anymore. I've looked at the metadata 
for ant.core you've attached and I can't really see how deleting it and using 
restore defaults can be different.
When you do restore defaults is tools.jar included? I'm asking that because it 
is part of the metadata you posted. If it is not included you probably need to 
do that manually.
Let us know if that works. If it does not, there's nothing else I can think of 
and since this is the only occurrence of this problem I suggest closing the 
bug report since you can workaround the problem by deleting the metadata for 
ant.ui.

Can you please try this with today's integration build? (I-20020607)
Ant error handling and messages have been improved for this build and may give 
us leads on tracking down this problem.
Thanks.
